TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP citizen of NORP national origin , who is born in DATE and lives in Požega , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . The respondent Government are represented by their Agent Ms Lidija PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant was employed as an agricultural technician in the Požega Penitentiary and ORG - a ORG prison for young offenders - ( ORG popravni dom Požega ) . On DATE the director of the prison dismissed the applicant and CARDINAL other employees , as a disciplinary penalty , for allegedly having voted for the formation of the so called GPE ( Srpska Autonomna Oblast “ PERSON ” ) and the secession of that Territory from GPE , in ORG in GPE in DATE ( hereinafter the “ Referendum ” ) . The decision of the applicant 's dismissal stated that the PERSON was part of the efforts to change the ORG frontiers by secession of parts of the NORP territory and their annexation to another ORG , which amounted to a criminal offence under LAW ( b ) of LAW . The Referendum was found to be contrary to LAW , thus illegal and participation in it was declared incompatible with service in State organs . The decision was , in addition , based on LAW , enacted in DATE .
The applicant appealed against his dismissal . On DATE ORG and ORG ( PERSON ORG popravnom domu u GPE ) dismissed the appeal .

On DATE the applicant filed an action challenging his dismissal in ORG ( PERSON ) . He claimed that he did not take part in ORG . He also claimed that ORG was enacted after his alleged participation in the Referendum and should not have been retroactively applied .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the applicant 's dismissal . It found the applicant ’s participation in the Referendum incompatible with his service in the Požega Penitentiary and ORG .
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal against the above judgment with ORG ( ORG u GPE ) , reiterating his previous arguments .
On DATE the appellate court dismissed the appeal and upheld the first instance judgment .
On DATE the applicant filed a request for revision with ORG ( PERSON ) . On DATE ORG upheld the lower courts’ judgments .

On DATE the applicant filed a constitutional complaint . He claimed that he had not taken part in the Referendum . He argued that ORG provision , prescribing that an employee in the prison may be dismissed if he was not fit for working in that institution , lacked sufficient clarity and , therefore , was inconsistent with the requirement of foreseeability . In his opinion the decision of his dismissal on account of his alleged participation in the Referendum violated his right to freedom of expression .

On DATE the applicant ’s constitutional complaint was rejected . ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) found the applicant ’s dismissal to be a consequence of his participation in the PERSON which it found incompatible with the applicant ’s employment in the Požega Penitentiary and ORG , pursuant to LAW ) of ORG .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of the Decree on the enforcement of penalties for crimes , economic offences and misdemeanours committed during the state of war or the state of immediate danger for the independence and unity of GPE ( ORG Decree - Uredba o izvršenju sankcija izrečenih za krivična djela , privredne prijestupe i prekršaje za vrijeme ratnog stanja ili u slučaju neposredne ugroženosti neovisnosti i jedinstvenosti PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL ) provides that the director of an institution may decide to dismiss an employee who is not fulfilling his duties or when it is established that he is not fit ( podoban ) to work in that institution .
